executive_summary: Fence contractors have enjoyed solid growth over the past five years. Growth in residential building construction activity was a boon to fence contractors. Surging housing starts and private spending on home improvements spurred by low interest rates and higher disposable income levels led to solid expansion. Nonetheless, interest rate hikes led to a slowdown in the residential market. The nonresidential construction market recovering from pandemic-induced declines offset slower growth in the residential market. Overall, revenue has been increasing at a CAGR of 1.4% over the past five years to total an estimated $20.6 billion in 2024, including an estimated increase of 0.2%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Residential Construction Market Has Been Volatile
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic prompted lower interest rates, stimulating housing starts and benefiting fence contractors as new single-family home-building activity surged. Simultaneously, private spending on home improvements rose as consumers sought to increase their homes' value amid escalating prices, bolstering expenditure on new fences and repair and maintenance of existing fences. As interest rates rose, there was a slowdown in housing starts and a decline in private spending on home improvements.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Nonresidential Market Has Endured Headwinds But Has Begun to Recover
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic hammered nonresidential construction markets following social distancing measures and declines in corporate profit, subduing commercial construction market growth. Despite interest rate hikes, the nonresidential market has begun recovering from pandemic-induced declines. As the economy reopened, fence contractors enjoyed solid growth from hotels and resorts as pent-up demand for travel spurred investment by these businesses.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Product Line Preferences Have Somewhat Shifted
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Preferences in the residential construction market have shifted to plastic and metal fences from wood. Climbing wood prices have compounded the expansion of plastic fence expenditures as consumers have opted for the less expensive material. Despite surging steel prices pushing up the cost of metal fences, the aesthetic appeal of these fences has contributed to greater expenditure in both the residential and nonresidential markets, particularly for ornamental fences.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Residential Market Will Contribute to Solid Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite a potential slowdown in 2024 because of high interest rates, subsequent rate cuts are set to accelerate growth in housing starts over the next five years. Also, these interest rate cuts will lead to an upswing in multifamily settings construction, contributing to solid growth in new construction for fence contractors. The next five years are set for an increase in private home improvement spending.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Nonresidential Market Will Be a Boon
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Strong growth in corporate profit levels will be a boon to fence contractors over the next five years. Increased expansionary projects on hotels, resorts and private clubs will benefit fence contractors. Growth in educational, healthcare and municipal facilities will support growth prospects in the institutional building market. Interest rate cuts will spur expansion in stores, restaurants and other commercial buildings.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit to Expand as Costs Fall
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While labor shortages will persist, particularly as both nonresidential and residential construction activity picks up, revenue growth will outpace wage growth, pushing up profit. Falling steel prices over the next five years will benefit fence contractors by reducing purchase costs. This trend will exacerbate consumer preferences shifting to metal fences over wood fences in the residential construction market, especially as wood prices continue to increase.

industry_definition: This industry comprises establishments that construct and install a wide range of fences, including residential fences, security fences and niche fences.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: Fence contractors mainly compete on price. Having a good reputation is also crucial in attracting customers, as contractors rely on referrals.
General contractors and remodelers are a threat to fence contractors. Other contractors offer fence construction services as a part of larger projects.

It's been a tale of two markets for contractors. Low interest rates spurred strong growth in the residential market for contractors. Nonresidential construction ramping up offset losses in the residential market following interest rate hikes.
Contractors are in a strong position for robust growth with anticipated interest rate cuts. This financial change will fuel an upswing in both residential and nonresidential construction projects.
No company has amassed more than 5.0% of the market. Fence contractors are small-scale businesses that operate locally, making it difficult for one company to accumulate a significant market share.
Fence contractors receive little public assistance. The primary source of aid for fence contractors comes from private associations like the American Fence Association.

The health of construction markets impacts volatility for fence contractors. Fluctuations in residential construction activity have had the most significant effect on volatility for fence contractors.
Profit suffers as material costs rise. The price of critical inputs like wood, steel and concrete have all risen recently, hindering profit.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment comprises homes that require fence construction, repair or maintenance.
This segment comprises fence construction, repair or maintenance at hotels, resorts, private clubs, buildings, corporate campuses, warehouses, retail centers and other commercial spaces.
This segment comprises fence construction, repair or maintenance at religious buildings, schools, colleges and universities, hospitals, government buildings, highways and public facilities.
This market comprises fence construction, repair and maintenance on farms to manage livestock and other animals effectively.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment comprises the construction, repair and maintenance of metal fences. The nonresidential commercial building and institutional market are critical downstream markets for chain-link fences.
This segment comprises the construction, repair and maintenance of wooden fences.

This segment comprises the construction, repair and maintenance of plastic fences. While contractors do perform maintenance and repair, there is also less of a need for maintenance on plastic fences than on other types.

This segment comprises the construction, repair and maintenance of concrete fences. Concrete fences across government facilities and commercial and industrial buildings because of their durability, strength and effectiveness in establishing a perimeter.

tier_1_suppliers: Sawmills & Wood Production in the US
Wire & Spring Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Fence contractors generate a substantial portion of their business from providing services to the housing market, principally from installing fences on building sites for single-family homes and multiunit apartment buildings. Growth in the value of residential construction represents a potential opportunity for the industry. Declines in the value of residential construction pose a potential threat to the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is the most populous region in the US. Since most business fence contractors generate is from the residential construction market, the Southeast's enormous market attracts fence contractors to the region. Florida bolsters the number of fence contractors in the Southeast because of the massive presence of downstream residential construction contractors like home builders.
The large commercial market in New York drives fence contractors to the Mid-Atlantic. New York is home to the fourth-highest concentration of fencing contractors.
Significant manufacturing activity in Illinois attracts fence contractors to the Great Lakes. Fencing contractors in the Great Lakes also enjoy proximity to lumber and steel producers.

Texas is the second most populous state in the US, driving fencing contractors to the state to provide work to the state's massive housing market. Texas is the largest cattle producer in the US, so fence contractors establish in the state to satisfy the agricultural sector's needs. Texas is also home to a vast number of horses requiring fencing.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Fencing contractors may require a license in some states and permits are required to ensure contractors conform to local regulations concerning the layout, type and height of fences.

The US Occupational Health & Safety Administration (OHSA) enforces standards for the construction sector. OHSA requires provisions for working in multi-level sites or confined spaces and sets limits governing noise tolerance.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry assistance level is low and steady.
The competition level is high and increasing.

factors_decreased_barrier: Globalization level is low and steady.

Contractors are typically required to obtain specific certifications to operate, but for most activities undertaken by fence contractors, the relevant certificates are easily obtainable by completing short courses.

Start-up costs for new entrants are relatively low and involve mainly rudimentary construction tools and equipment. Leasing equipment or subcontracting work to specialists decreases capital expenditure for concrete fence construction.

New entrants will face difficulty establishing a foothold in a market because of the lack of a reputation for quality work and timeliness. Successfully competing on price or subcontracting to other fence contractors helps companies establish reputations.
Since heavy machinery is only sometimes used and can be rented, fence construction is labor-intensive, so new entrants may face difficulty hiring and retaining workers.

basis_points.basis_description: Fence contractors mainly compete on price.
Having a good reputation is also crucial in attracting customers, as contractors rely on referrals.
General contractors and remodelers are a threat to fence contractors. Other contractors offer fence construction services as a part of larger projects.

concentration_points.concentration_description: It's challenging to gain a considerable market share. Most fence contractors operate locally. The dispersion of demand for fencing throughout the country makes it difficult for one company to amass a high market share.
Expanding into regions where a fence contractor has no established reputation is risky. Expansions can be risky since most companies generate business through word-of-mouth referrals.

Most fence contractors are nonemployers, keeping market share concentration low. Even fence contractors with employees employ very few, with more than eighty percent of companies employing less than ten people.
Fence contractors are often unwilling to employ workers full-time because of the additional employment costs, like health benefits and vacation time, that come with full-time employees.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Fence Contractors Have Endured Higher Purchase Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs include equipment and tools like vans and saws for new construction and material purchases, including lumber, stone, plastic, glass and aluminum.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Labor Shortages Led to Rising Wage Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As residential construction activity surged early in the period, fence contractors' wages rose to satisfy this downstream market. Surging inflation.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Since heavy machinery is only sometimes used and can be rented, fence construction is labor-intensive, so new entrants may face difficulty hiring and retaining workers.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Fluctuations in the residential market has contributed to volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Fencing contractors derive a considerable amount of work from new single-family homes, so the number of housing starts greatly affects revenue volatility.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The level of nonresidential construction activity
volatility_points.volatility_description: Corporate profit levels affect volatility in the commercial construction market, from which fence contractors derive a significant portion of their work.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The development of easily installable plastic fences propelled the popularity of plastic fences. These fencing products make it much easier for fence contractors to expedite installation and reduce manpower costs.

FAQs.question: Does your company primarily work with residential or nonresidential construction markets? Can you easily switch between these markets?
FAQs.answer: In the coming years, the nonresidential market is expected to outperform its residential counterpart. Being able to switch between these two markets is essential to achieving sustained growth.

FAQs.question: What is the size of your staff? How does that compare to your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Maintaining a large, full time staff can significantly increase a business' cost of operations. We only hire employees as an when needed to not increase wages cost.

FAQs.question: How do rising prices of key construction inputs impact profit?
FAQs.answer: When the price of construction inputs increases, profit may face declines.

FAQs.question: In light of increasing wage costs, has your company considered using new technologies to increase productivity or reduce total employment?
FAQs.answer: While labor will always be a crucial input, investing in new tools and vehicles can sometimes aid in controlling rising wage costs without sacrificing productivity.

FAQs.question: Have productivity issues ever kept you from winning lucrative contracts over larger competitors?
FAQs.answer: Investing in new, time-saving equipment can often times boost productivity of staff and may enable an operator to bid successfully on larger contracts.

FAQs.question: Do you work with local or national trade associations to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Working with these associations can help shape a more benign operating environment for a business and thus support growth.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met on and off the construction site?
FAQs.answer: Construction sites are typically a dangerous place and manual labor can result in numerous injuries, leaving companies vulnerable to lawsuits.

FAQs.question: How has your company adapted to the increasing prices of key inputs over the past year?
FAQs.answer: For many businesses, a substantial share of revenue is consumed by the purchase of materials, prices of which have steadily increased in recent years. Increase in purchase cost decreases overall profit margin.

FAQs.question: How does your company address seasonal fluctuations in workload?
FAQs.answer: Construction markets are notoriously volatile. If contractors do not adequately plan for these fluctuations, profit margins can be severely diminished.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company to suppliers? How can you shore up your existing relationships?
FAQs.answer: Initially it is difficult to promote the company. But once you start completing jobs and keep on buying materials from the same supplier, it becomes easy to promote the company and helps maintain relationships.

FAQs.question: How do you keep track of the company's expenditures? What costs can you cut back on?
FAQs.answer: By following a systematic procedure of maintaining records of all expenditures, you can keep track of where expenses are increasing and decreasing. You can cut back on administrative expenses and only hire employees as and when needed.

FAQs.question: Which niches, if any, do you cater to? How do you keep track of the latest trends?
FAQs.answer: Establishing a leading position in a niche market, such as horse fencing, could yield revenue despite intense external competition. By reading up on latest residential and nonresidential construction trends, you can cater to niche markets.

FAQs.question: How does nonresidential building affect industry revenue? How would an increase in private nonresidential construction impact your business?
FAQs.answer: A significant portion of revenue is generated from installing fences for nonresidential buildings. For commercial and institutional buildings, services range from providing ornamental fences to security fences. With the increase in private nonresidential construction, demand for new fence construction will also increase, which will help increase industry revenue.

FAQs.question: As the mortgage rate increases, how will this impact residential demand for your services? How can you bolster your other revenue streams to compensate?
FAQs.answer: As the 30-year conventional mortgage rate increases, so does the effective cost of borrowing to purchase a new home which decrease demand for industry services. To compensate revenue streams, contracts are signed with developers which brings a fixed amount of revenue every year.

FAQs.question: How will an increase in residential construction affect demand for your business? How will you expand your capacity in preparation?
FAQs.answer: Contractors generate a substantial portion of their revenue from providing services to the housing market, principally from the installation of fences on building sites for single-family homes and multiunit apartment buildings. With the increase in residential construction, demand for new fence construction will also increase, which will positively affect industry revenue. To match up to new work, temporary workers are hired.
